meanings.definition: A tall, slender tower or steeple.
meanings.sent1: The castle had beautiful spiers reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The church spiers stood out against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The spiers of the building seemed to touch the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The spires of the cathedral were like fingers pointing to the heavens.
meanings.sent5: The spiers of the old castle were a symbol of its grandeur.

meanings.definition: To look at or search for something with keen interest or curiosity.
meanings.sent1: She spiers at the map, trying to find the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: He spiers through the crowd to catch a glimpse of the performer.
meanings.sent3: The detective spiers around the crime scene for clues.
meanings.sent4: The cat spiers at the bird perched on the fence.
meanings.sent5: The child spiers into the dark closet, searching for the missing toy.
